sources.title: Law of the North (1932) BILL CODY
sources.description:
First Time on YouTube!
Stars: Bill Cody, Andy Shuford, Nadine Dore
Directed by: Harry L. Fraser

An innocent man tries to clear himself of murder, but the judge wants him hung as soon as possible.

TRIVIA: Born William Joseph Cody on January 5, 1891, in St. Paul, Minnesota, he became a popular cowboy star during the 1920s and 1930s. Cody is often associated with the B-Western genre, where he played the heroic cowboy figure, a staple of American cinema during that period.

metadata.Plot: Hanley shoots a man and then frames Bill Roberts. Being the Judge he then holds court planning to hang Bill but Bill's friends effect his escape. Andy tries to lead Hanley astray by misleading him as to Bill's location. But Bill changes plans and Hanley catches up with him and this leads to the showdown.
metadata.Actors: Bill Cody, Andy Shuford, Nadine Dore
